visualization_prompt: Generate a 3D column chart showing monthly sales comparison between Product A and Product B using Highcharts with null value handling and custom styling
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two categorical series (Product A/B) with six temporal observations each, representing monthly sales data. Null values indicate missing sales records. Synthetic data follows realistic retail patterns with μ=2.8 (Product A) and μ=2.2 (Product B), showing natural variance (σ≈1.6). The 3D column chart enhances categorical comparison while maintaining Tufte's data-ink ratio through minimal shading. Cairo's perceptual principles are applied through color contrast (#7cb5ec vs #434348) and direct labeling. Depth cues in the 3D presentation help visualize missing data points (null values) as structural gaps. Axis styling (12pt labels, #333 color) ensures legibility against the #f0f0f0 background, maintaining WCAG AA contrast standards.
